Summary PRIOR Company Experience:  
 
As an Associate Consultant to SIEMENS, configuring Soarian Financials with my skills and 
qualification which will impart revenue from Stakeholders/Clients by increasing the availability of latest releases after build,deploy,test & release 
 
Roles and Responsibilities As a Clear Case Engineer: 
•	Customized training of ClearCase users.  
•	Writing & Maintaining CC Triggers (language: Perl)  
•	Replica creation of VOB’s.  
•	Monitoring Synchronization of VOB’s.  
•	Changing mastership of ClearCase Objects.  
•	Recovering lost Packets.  
•	Manage ClearCase Licenses and Registries.  
•	Checking ClearCase Server log files.  
•	Interface with System admin to ensure regular backups.  
•	Installation of ClearCase on NT clients.  
•	Support Developers for any configuration Issues  
 
 
Roles and Responsibilities As a Build Engineer: 
Daily Build Execution & support using IBM Build Forge  
•	Responsible for creating New projects for different Releases 
•	Building project consists of: 
o	Gathering and Compilation of Source Code using ANT & Gradle 
o	Generating Build Reports in HTML and store in DB 
o	Deploy using SCDS Application & DB Apply 
o	Follow-up developer using request tracking tool Clear Quest for any failures & Issues 
o	Kick-off Smoke Test up on results PASS, execute Regression test 
o	Store and Maintain Build out-put (Media & Logs) in a Repository 
o	Deliver Soft Ware to Clients based on Release Management Requests 
 
Roles and Responsibilities As a CI Engineer: 
 
•	Responsible for Create & Maintaining Continuous Integration Pipe Line 
•	Create & Maintain Jenkins jobs for CI Compile (Gradle & Groovy) for several projects 
•	Create & Maintain Adopters for CI Compile Project in Build Forge for several Releases 
•	Create & Maintain Adopters for CI Pipe Line (Compile Loop, Deploy Loop, DB Apply Loop, Test Loop, Release Loop) Summary PRIOR Company Experience:

Experience Lead Engineer - Next Generation Workplace Services Project HP (Shell Account) October 2014  – Present (11 months) Having completed the Moka5 project, I was asked to stay on and assume another project role for HP on the Shell Account. 
 
I am working with the Chief Architect, Lead Architects, Chief Engineer and managing globally dispersed Engineering resources to deliver new capabilities for the End User Computing (EUC) environment at Shell. 
 
The Initial focus is on File Storage, Printing and Windows Client. Utilising cloud solutions where possible and attempting to automate and instrument all aspects of the service, driving towards a NoOps model. 
 
This includes schedule Creation and Management, coordination of Engineering resources in multiple global locations. Evaluating new solutions to best meet the customers requirements and cost profile, creating detailed Design documents and producing Test strategies and implementation activities. 
 
Multiple NGWS workstreams are in progress and I divide my time accordingly. 
At all times, I ensure that the solutions I engineer are in accordance with the Shell's business requirements. 
I have enjoyed becoming familiar with new concepts of Object Storage, Enterprise File Sync and exploring the use of HP's 3PAR Storage technology.  
 
The technologies in use are SharePoint 2013, Windows Storage Server 2012 R2, BranchCache. EFSS solutions, File Storage, 3PAR StoreServe File Controllers and Storage Arrays. Hybrid Cloud. Direct Printing, NoOps / DevOps automation and Windows 10. Lead Engineer - Moka5 Desktop Anywhere Project HP (Shell Account) September 2013  –  October 2014  (1 year 2 months) BYOD project for Shell, with potential for 60,000 users. 
Using Moka5, hosted in AWS Cloud. 
 
Leading HP engineering team (based in KL, Malaysia). Responsible for all technical aspects of project delivery. Delivering the detailed design, automation spec, fulfilment processes etc. 
 
I optimised the Shell corporate desktop image (32bit & 64bit) for the Moka5 virtual container and included a custom setup wizard of my own design to guide Users through the initial boot and assist with Windows configuration that would usually be carried out by a Field Service Engineer. 
 
The custom setup Wizard was very popular and I completed other development work for HP/Shell, I created a tool for exporting Secure Email encryption certificates to a Smart Card to support the Secure Mobile Email initiative at Shell. 
 
I Delivered Development, Pre-Production and Production Moka5 Server environments in AWS each including a discrete Active Directory for Moka5 User accounts. Development and Pre-Production are spun up only during upgrade/development cycles to save cost. 
I managed the successful DR failover test, bringing up a parallel VPC in a different AWS Region and restoring the instances and data. This relied on several key AWS technologies to ensure a rapid restoration of service. 
 
I provided extensive support scripts for the service desk and was able to use my prior experience to prevent project delays. 
 
The Service went operational on schedule, capable of on-boarding 100 users per day due to the automation I engineered for the solution. 
 
I created Moka5 hostcheck Compliance scripts for Mac and PC to meet Shell IRM requirements, this allowed Users with un-managed hosts to access the Moka5 service, increasing the target scope for Shell Users. 
 
Once operational, I managed a PoC to test the latest Moka5 BareMetal Player release. Freelance Technical Architect BP January 2012  –  August 2013  (1 year 8 months) Stockley Park, Uxbridge Working for IT&S, GOI Strategy & Change on a project to roll out a 5000 user deployment using MokaFive to support BYOD at BP. 
Primarily to recover BP supplied hardware from contractors and other 3rd parties working at BP. 
 
I was responsible for all technical elements of the project, including designing the Server Architecture for PROD, OAT & DR environments, installing and configuring the servers, integrating the MokaFive management server with BP's Active Directory, performing DR failover acceptance tests.. I designed the virtual desktop (LivePC) capture and maintenance processes, ensuring that computer objects conform to BP's AD Administration model. (Virtual = Physical). 
 
I designed and documented all security and operational procedures, including authoring comprehensive Work instructions for the IBM Ops team. 
I trained the support team using MokaFive training materials in a training lab that I built, then oversaw the first 6 months of operations.. 
 
I oversaw the introduction of a new VPN solution, for which I designed the authentication model and integrated into the LivePC to enable users to self-provision by downloading the MokaFive player and subscribing to the 'Virtual Voyager'​ LivePC. 
 
The project went operational on schedule and rapidly gained many thousands of Users. 
 
I was also Technical Lead for the cloud based 'Online Backup' service, I administered the online console for a technical evaluation/pilot.. I extended the backup rules to fit with the BP corporate desktop image and ensured compatibility with a layered MokaFive LivePC and worked on the AD integration and business requirements, working closely with the PM to drive the project to success. 
 IT Specialist (BP Global Build Manager) IBM October 2009  –  December 2011  (2 years 3 months) Stockley Park, Uxbridge Global Build Manager in IBM Global Client Services team 
 
TUPE transferred to IBM from BP, I continued in my role as Global build manager, responsible for maintaining the global 'gold image'​ builds for BP. 
I led the Windows 7 MDT2010 based build efforts, culminating in a single build process capable of building 50+ different desktops, laptops and rugged tablets. 
 
This MDT based build was used to sucessfully migrate the entire PC estate to Windows 7 from Windows XP. 
 
I evaluated pre-release hardware from vendors on behalf of BP, for suitability for the BP environment. 
My recommendations directly influenced BP's procurement decisions. 
 
My team were responsible for packaging the monthly security compliance releases, for Altiris SWD to the BP estate. 
 
I maintained the Global 'bare metal' build capability using Altiris Deploymemt Solution. 
 
I also took on the service supporting the BP Shipping maritime build maintenance and development.
